meanings.definition: The upper part of a classical building supported by columns.
meanings.sent1: The entablatures of the ancient temple were beautifully carved.
meanings.sent2: The museum guide pointed out the intricate entablatures on the historic building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the entablatures, thinking they were giant steps.
meanings.sent4: The entablatures stood tall like guardians, protecting the entrance to the grand palace.
meanings.sent5: Visitors marveled at the detailed entablatures, admiring the craftsmanship of the architects.

meanings.definition: A horizontal structure supported by columns or walls.
meanings.sent1: The garden pergola had entablatures that provided shade on sunny days.
meanings.sent2: The ancient ruins revealed remnants of entablatures that once adorned the courtyard.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the entablatures were bridges in their imaginary world.
meanings.sent4: The entablatures in the park created a picturesque backdrop for the outdoor concert.
meanings.sent5: The architect designed the modern building with sleek entablatures for a minimalist look.
